etymology.description: Depicts a man wearing a ceremonial hat -> borrowed for abstract meanings
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a ceremonial figure, emphasizing authority. Over time, it was borrowed for abstract concepts like 'exempt' or 'dismiss.' The derivative 冕(冕) (miǎn, 'crown') retains the original meaning related to ceremonial apparel.

examples.chinese: 学生们免缴学费(學生們免繳學費)。
examples.english: Students are exempt from paying tuition.

examples.chinese: 因工作繁忙(因工作繁忙)，他被免去部分职责(他被免去部分職責)。
examples.pinyin: Yīn gōngzuò fánmáng, tā bèi miǎn qù bùfen zhízé.
examples.english: Due to his busy work schedule, he was dismissed from some of his duties.

examples.chinese: 为了节省开支(為了節省開支)，公司决定免发年终奖(公司決定免發年終獎)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile jiéshěng kāizhī, gōngsī juédìng miǎn fā niánzhōng jiǎng.
examples.english: In order to save expenses, the company decided to avoid giving out the year-end bonus.
